bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Defendant Testimony
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: That said engine and car were not in charge or under the control and management of this petitioner, and that this petitioner was not present and had no interest in running the same at the time of said killing, or at any time.

That this petitioner did not commit the crime charged against him, or any crime, but is innocent thereof and unjustly confined. That it did not appear upon the whole examination before said justice of the peace aforesaid, that any offence had been committed, or that this petitioner had committed the crime charged against him, or any crime, or that there was probable cause for charging this petitioner with the offence, or any offence. That the proof was not evident nor the presumption great from said evidence that this petitioner is or was guilty of murder, or any of the degrees thereof, or of any crime whatever.

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to said Lewis Byrd, Sheriff, commanding him to have the body of M.A. Walker, your petitioner, before you Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there e considered by your Honor concerning him, together with the time and cause of his, or my, detection, and said wait; and that your petitioner may them be restored to his liberty.
Territory of Washington County of Pierce } ss.
M.A. Walker being first duly sworn says that he is the petitioner mentioned in the foregoing petition; that he has heard the same read, knows the contacts thereof, and the same is truce.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 25th 19th day of August, 1885
Notary Public in and for Pierce County, Washington Territory.
